member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.Physical.ExclusionFilters.Sensitive

member.summary: Exclude files and directories when is set on .

summary.para: A file watcher that watches a physical filesystem for changes.
Triggers events on when files are created, change, renamed, or deleted.

summary.para: A change token that polls for file system changes.
This change token does not raise any change callbacks. Callers should watch for to turn from false to true and dispose the token after this happens.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.PhysicalFileProvider.Watch(System.String)
member.param: Filter string used to determine what files or folders to monitor. Examples: \*\*/\*.cs, \*.\*, subfolder/\*\*/\*.cshtml.

returns.para: An that's notified when a file matching is added, modified, or deleted.
A if has invalid filter characters or is an absolute path or is outside the root directory specified in the constructor .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.PhysicalFileProvider.Root
member.summary: The root directory for this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.PhysicalFileProvider.UseActivePolling
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if this instance of actively polls for file changes.
When , the returned by actively polls for file changes ( is ) instead of being passive.
This property is only effective when is set.
member.returns: The default value of this property is determined by the value of the environment variable named DOTNET_USE_POLLING_FILE_WATCHER. When or 1, this property defaults to ; otherwise .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.PhysicalFileProvider.UsePollingFileWatcher
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that determines if this instance of uses polling to determine file changes.
By default, uses to listen to file change events for . is ineffective in some scenarios such as mounted drives. Polling is required to effectively watch for file changes.
member.returns: The default value of this property is determined by the value of environment variable named DOTNET_USE_POLLING_FILE_WATCHER. When or 1, this property defaults to ; otherwise .
